CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, Louisiana edition, July 1, 1944, pg. 2, reads: "Pittsburgh Welcomes Returned 99th Hero - Modest and shy, Capt. James T. Wiley of Pittsburgh, Pa., was the center of attraction in his hometown last week, when 50,000 citizens turned out to give him a rousing celebration.  The 25-year-old officer-pilot, wearing the Air Medal with an Oak Leaf Cluster is back from Italy, where he flew 101 missions with the 99th Pursuit Squadron.  Included in the celebration was a colorful parade and an open-air program.  A $500 War Bond was given Captain Wiley by Mrs. Robert L. Vann, for The Pittsburgh Courier and friends.  One of the features of the parade was the appearance of a detachment of soldiers, shown in the scene at left, from Camp Reynolds, Pa., In photo at right, Captain Wiley, center, is congratulated by Mayor Cornelius Scully, as Maj. George S. Roberts, commanders of the 99th Pursuit Squadron, beams his approval.  Both officers are home on leave.  Major Roberts is a native of Fairmont, W. Va.,  - Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Man wearing dark suit, striped tie, and eyeglasses, speaking behind microphone, with Pittsburgh Mayor Cornelius D. Scully, Tuskegee Airman James T. Wiley, and Jessie Vann seated behind him, on platform at Kennard Field for ceremony honoring Wiley, with loudspeaker for Ann Street Radio, Homestead, in background
